perturbation.original_text:
Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B shall pay one-month freight as
liquidated damages in case of termination of the Agreement without consent.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B may terminate the agreement at any time without penalty.
perturbation.explanation: Section 10 initially states Party B needs written consent for early termination and must pay one month's freight as liquidated damages if they terminate without consent. The modified clause removes the requirement for consent and states Party B can terminate at any time without penalty. This directly contradicts the first part of the original sentence, and creates ambiguity about the conditions and penalties for early termination. This provides an in-text contradiction.
